topic.title: Hints and tips when working with a shared dictionary

body.p: If a term in a shared dictionary is locked although nobody is working with it, delete the files with the dictionary name and extension R-I and R-D in the directory \otm\dict. These files contain locking information. They are usually synchronously updated unless there is a network failure.
If a shared dictionary is not available, that is, it is grayed, check if the drive on which the dictionary resides is still connected using net use or the Windows Explorer.
